runs.name: story_teller
runs.task_description: Create an application story for a local Library Manager app that stores its data as JSON files on the user's computer. The app will support managing books, members, and book loans. It must enforce business rules to prevent borrowing if a book is out of stock or if a member has exceeded their loan limit, and runs fully offline.

runs.name: relationship_generator
runs.task_description: Create a Python class relationship model from provided story.

runs.name: relationship_validator
runs.task_description: Validate the generated relationship.json against the expected relationship example/schema and decide whether to continue, rerun, or break.

runs.name: attribution_generator
runs.task_description: Generate Python class blueprints (imports, fields, constructors, methods, notes) for all classes defined in the provided relationship.json context.

runs.name: attribution_validator
runs.task_description: Validate the generated attribution/blueprint JSON against the expected attribution example/schema and decide whether to continue, rerun, or break.

runs.name: manifest_generator
runs.task_description: Generate a complete manifest.json for the context provided by relationship.json and attributes.json as the architectural sources of truth.

runs.name: manifest_validator
runs.task_description: Validate the generated manifest.json against the expected manifest example/schema and decide whether to continue, rerun, or break.

runs.name: py_run_generator
runs.task_description: Generate a runs.json file that contains one run per Python class defined in the provided manifest.json. Each run must target exactly one class and write to project_name/<class.file_path>. Use only the manifest as the architectural source of truth.
